alert.note: Alert for Curry County; Quay County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 8:24PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORM OUTFLOW WINDS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN QUAY AND NORTHERN CURRY COUNTIES THROUGH 845 PM MDT... At 822 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking an outflow boundary along a line extending from near San Jon to 11 miles northwest of Wheatland to near Quay. Movement of the boundary was south at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Quay, San Jon, Grady, Ragland, Broadview, Wheatland, Forrest, Mcalister and Bard. This includes Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 353 and 365. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building.
